sub_topic: The self-similarity of the Barnsley fern.
message_1: What is the scaling factor of the Barnsley fern when the vertical stretch is 85% and the horizontal stretch is 60%?
message_2:
The scaling factor of the Barnsley fern can be determined by multiplying the vertical stretch by the horizontal stretch. In this case, the vertical stretch is 85% (0.85) and the horizontal stretch is 60% (0.6). 

Scaling factor = Vertical stretch × Horizontal stretch
Scaling factor = 0.85 × 0.6
Scaling factor = 0.51

The scaling factor of the Barnsley fern is 0.51 when the vertical stretch is 85% and the horizontal stretch is 60%.
